item.description:
Hi NLPers,

First of all, I need to apologize ? we are moving this month?s meeting to February 28. Although NLP allows you to do many amazing things, being in two places at once is not one of those things, and I will be in New Orleans with Habitat for Humanity next week.

Secondly, a reminder of a new feature for our meetup: we will be starting the meeting at 6:30 for those new to NLP (or those who want a review), and also for those who want to come early to socialize/network. At 7pm we we will get rolling with the main event for the evening.

The Main Event: Language Patterns

We had spent one meetup on language patterns last year, but the topic is so rich, we?re going to re-visit it!

We will briefly review some of the basic language patterns from last year (verb tenses, presuppositions, nominalizations) and then explore some new ones: likely patterns are analog/digital shifts, reversing presuppositions, and/but, and forced choice. If those names don?t mean anything to you, don?t worry: it will all become clear by the end of the evening.

If we have time, I will also demonstrate the Fast Allergy cure. Its a pretty elegant, very effective technique (it cured me of a wheat allergy in one session).

Everyone is welcome to this meetup, from beginners to experts. Feel free to contact me if you have any questions about the group in general or this meeting in particular.

Looking forward to seeing you there!
Adam.

PS A reminder about the venue:
Andover-Newton Theological School is conveniently located in Newton Center, with free parking. You can get directions here:
http://ants.edu/about...
Here is a map of the campus:
http://ants.edu/about...
Please note that this location is NOT handicapped accessible, as it entails climbing a short flight of stairs.

Adam Marx
NLP Master Practitioner
New Light NLP
"Helping you to become the you that you want to be"
Coaching, Counseling, and Training
adam@NewLightNLP.com

group.name: The Greater Boston NLP and Hypnosis Meetup Group

item.name: The Greater Boston Neuro Linguistic Programming February Meetup
